.. py:class:: Logger(logLevel=LOGSTD, output=sys.stdout)


   Bases: :py:obj:`contextlib.ContextDecorator`

   High-performance logger for scientific/HPC applications.

   Provides log levels, error/warning/info/debug, and assertion logic.
   Thread-safe and context-enabled. All methods use camelCase.

   :param logLevel: Initial log level (default: 2 = LOGSTD)
   :type logLevel: int, optional
   :param output: Output stream (default: sys.stdout)
   :type output: file-like, optional

   .. py:attribute:: LOGERROR
      :value: 0

      

   .. py:attribute:: LOGWARN
      :value: 1

      

   .. py:attribute:: LOGSTD
      :value: 2

      

   .. py:attribute:: LOGVERBOSE
      :value: 3

      

   .. py:attribute:: LOGDEBUG
      :value: 4

      

   .. py:attribute:: LOGDEBUG2
      :value: 5

      

   .. py:attribute:: LOGDEBUG3
      :value: 6

      

   .. py:attribute:: LOGNAMES
      :value: ['ERROR  ', 'WARNING', 'STD    ', 'VERBOSE', 'DEBUG  ', 'DEBUG2 ', 'DEBUG3 ']
